Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearance as to Rafael J. Barbosa-Lopez held on 8/28/2013. Defendant was interviewed by the USPO and was brought before the Magistrate Judge, was advised of rights and provided with copy of the Indictment. Financial Affidavit was issued and approved. CJA counsel was appointed to represent the defendant. Defendant was temporarily detained. Arraignment/Detention set for 8/30/2013 at 3:30 PM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. Hearing set for 5:14 p.m. Hearing held at 5:14 p.m. Hearing ended at 5:17 p.m. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (sr) (Entered: 08/29/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearance as to Mike Camacho-Almodovar (17), Francisco Cotto-Gonzalez (42), Gilberto Lopez-Andino (51), Christian J. Algarin-Martinez (102), Gisela Del Valle-Burgos (122) and Keyla L. Garcia-Montanez (124) was held on 8/28/2013. Defendants were provided with copies of the Indictment and advised as to their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendants will be represented by CJA counsel. Defendants ordered temporarily detained. Arraignment/Detention Hearing is set for 8/30/2013 at 1:30 PM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. (Interpreter Janis PalmI & Mary Jo Smith) (mc) (Entered: 08/29/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Arraignment/Detention as to Mike Camacho-Almodovar (17) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 and Francisco Cotto-Gonzalez (42) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 and Gisela Del Valle- Burgos (122) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/30/2013. Present were: AUSA Alberto Lopez,  Teresa Zapata, Victor Acevedo and Attys Esther Castro, Laura Maldonado, Rick Nemcick. Dfts are UC. Defendants were found competent to understand the proceedings. They waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions.Case is referred to Judge Carmen C. Cerezo for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsels informed that they had nothing to offer. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:30.Hearing ended at 02:56.Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (al) (Entered: 09/03/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Arraignment/Detention as to Gilberto Lopez-Andino (51) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/30/2013. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez, Teresa Zapata, Victor Acevedo and Atty Juan Albino. Dft is UC. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s)1,2,3,4,5. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions.Case is referred to Judge Carmen C. Cerezo for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel argued for bail. Gvmt moved for detention. After hearing the parties the Court ordered defendant released under the following conditions: $5,000.00 secured by cash/property-bonding company accepted, drug testing/treatment, all other standard conditions of release apply. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:30.Hearing ended at 02:47.Interpreter Sonia Crescion1. (al) (Entered: 09/03/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Arraignment/Detention as to Christian J. Algarin-Martinez (102) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 8/30/2013. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez, Teresa Zapata, Victor Acevedo and Atty Jennie Espada. Dft is UC. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1,2,3,4,5. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions.Case is referred to Judge Carmen C. Cerezo for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel argued for bail. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention Hearings as to Geraldo Flores-Laforet (47) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 9/3/2013. SAUSA Victor Acevedo and defense counsel Antonio Bisbal were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, the Government proffered defendant's role and/or participation as a seller, runner and being seen firearmed. There are videos and witnesses as part of the evidence and moved for detention without bail. Defense counsel proffered that defendant is working, and moved for bond. After hearing the parties and relying on the weight of the evidence, the Court set bond as to Geraldo Flores-Laforet (47) in the amount of $10,000 secured by property. Standard release conditions, father to be qualified as third party custodian, home detention with electronic monitoring device, drug testing, drug treatment, work, study and relocate to live with father are all imposed. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:30. Hearing held at 02:49. Hearing ended at 03:00. Interpreter N/A. (br) (Entered: 09/04/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Yaimir Hernandez-Caraballo (99) was held on 9/3/2013. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez, AUSA Teresa Zapata, SAUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty Ramon Garay. Deft was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The deft is granted 7 days to obtain discovery and 14 days thereafter for the filing of motions. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearance as to Edwin X. Colon-Roman (12) was held on 12/20/2013. Defendant was provided with a copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and his rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by the defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by the FPD's office. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Juan A. Franco-Ortiz (37) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 4/8/2014. AUSA Albert Lopez and defense counsel Raul Bandas were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel had no evidence, since defendant was serving sentence in the state court. Although the pretrial report states that defendant refused to be interviewed prior to the initial appearance, counsel informed that arrangements have been made for defendant to be interviewed by the probation officer today. The Court ordered that any additional information will be added to the present pretrial report. The Government moved for detention. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, Courtroom 1.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:59. Hearing ended at 10:04. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (br) (Entered: 04/08/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Arraignment/Bail as to Jose E. Delgado-Rodriguez (4) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 4/21/2014. Present were AUSA Carlos Cardona and Mr. Israel Alicea-Luciano. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all count. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail, Mr. Alicea stated that they had reviewed the PT report and had nothing to offer at this time, but reserved the right to reopen hearing. The Court ordered defendant detained  without bail, based on findings that he's a risk of flight, a danger to the community and a prior history of use of controlled substances. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:32.Hearing ended at 09:35.Interpreter -Enith Valdes. (yr) (Entered: 04/22/2014)

Munute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Bail as to Maurice Rowe-Figueroa (3) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 6/11/2014. Present: SAUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Miguel Oppenheimer. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts of the Indictment. The government has seven (7) days to produce discovery, and the defense has fourteen (14) days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to District Judge Carmen Cerezo for trial and further proceedings. As to detention: The Government moves for detention. Defense will not request bail. Court finds that the defendant poses both a flight risk and danger to the community and is ordered to remain under custody pending trial. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Jose G. Ortiz-Camacho (10) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 7/3/2014. AUSA Carmen Marquez and defense counsel Julie Soderlund were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel had nothing to offer. The Government concurred with the pretrial recommendation for detention, this is a presumption case and proffered defendant's role as a leader. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:49. Hearing ended at 09:53. Interpreter Janis Palma. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Roberto J. Lopez-Hernandez (38) held on 8/12/2014. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Jorge Vega were present. Defense counsel informed that defendant had recently arrived to the jurisdiction and needed additional time to meet with his client. In addition, counsel requested a continuance to finalize the plea negotiations and prepare for the change of plea hearing. The Government had no objection. The Court granted the request and rescheduled the hearing. The speedy trial is tolled in the best interest of justice and to conclude plea negotiations. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll as to Francisco Ortiz-Garcia (72). Change of Plea Hearing was called but not held on 9/8/2014. AUSA Alberto Lopez was present. Counsel Edgar Sanchez was not present. Defendant was present and under custody. The Court addressed defendant as to his health status and as to counsel's whereabouts. The Government informed that counsel has had communication with him and to his client through defendant's wife, since defendant was out of the jurisdiction. The Court ordered a show cause to counsel why sanctions should not be imposed for failure to appear and until this Friday, 9/12/2014, to do so. Thereafter, a new change of plea hearing will be set. The Court ordered that a notice to MDC be sent for an evaluation and treatment for defendant's health condition. Show Cause Response due by 9/12/2014. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 10:34. Hearing ended at 10:39. Interpreter Janis Palma. (br) (Entered: 09/12/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll as to Roberto J. Lopez-Hernandez (38). Change of Plea Hearing was called but not held on 9/8/2014. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defene counsel Jorge Vega were present. Defense counsel informed that the plea agreement was discussed with his client, but defendant has chosen to exercise his right to a fair trial and not change his plea. The offer was to plea guilty as to Counts 1 and 6. Counsel informed what was being offered and what was discussed with defendant. The Court addressed defendant during a colloquy. The Government stated that this was a second offer, that this plea agreement is final and no further offers will be conducted. The case is referred to the presiding Judge for trial setting. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:44. Hearing ended at 09:59. Interpreter Janis Palma. (br) (Entered: 09/17/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Attorney Appointment Hearing as to Roberto J. Lopez-Hernandez (38) held on 9/8/2014, which was not previously scheduled. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Jorge Vega were present. Defendant was present and under custody. Upon conclusion of the attempted change of plea hearing, defense counsel informed that defendant stated his request for new appointed counsel. Defendant informed that he is willing to plea, but needs a second opinion as to what is being offered. The Government stated that, although defendant has a right to counsel, but if not content with the offer, he can not be requesting a change of attorney. Regardless of a new attorney, the offer remains as such. There is no reason or basis for a new attorney. The Court addressed defendant. There is nothing in the record that would suggest that defendant does not have ineffective assistance of counsel. Defendant's oral motion for new counsel is denied. Counsel informed that he will meet again with his client and inform the Court if defendant will plea or not. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing held at 09:59. Hearing ended at 10:06. Interpreter Janis Palma. (br) (Entered: 09/17/2014)

Colon-Morales (15) held on 12/11/2014:Present: AUSA Alvero Lopez and Atty Joseph Laws. Dft is U/C. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Benjamin Montanez-Ortiz (111) held on 12/15/2014. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Kendys Pimentel were present. Defense counsel informed that defendant wish to withdraw the change of plea motion. The parties were heard as to defendant's criminal history category. The Court addressed defendant. During the colloquy, defendant stated he wish to plea. The Court gave a recess until 3:00 PM for defendant to speak with his attorney. The case was recalled and the parties were present in court. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Indictment. At the time of sentencing, the Government will request the dismissal of the remaining counts. The defendant is to remain under custody. The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. A report and recommendation will be issued. Sentencing Hearing set for 3/18/2015 04:15 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. s/c: PO through e-mail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 01:55. Hearing recessed at 2:07. Hearing resumed at 3:22. Hearing ended at 03:52. Interpreter Edna Brayfield and Enith Valdes. (br) (Entered: 12/15/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Maurice Rowe-Figueroa (3) held on 1/30/2015. Present were AUSA Alberto Lopez and Mr. Miguel Oppenheimer. Dft was present and under custody. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to understand the proceedings. He is advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to counts One (1) and Six (6)of the indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Cerezo. Defendant to remain under custody. (E-mail to USPO) (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:47.Hearing ended at 03:09. Interpreter -Sonia Crescioni. (yr) (Entered: 01/30/2015)

Miu£nute entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Bond Revocation Hearing as to Janette Gonzalez-Cotto (56) held on 2/5/2015. PRESENT: AUSA Alberto Lopez-Rocafort and Defense Counsel Joseph Boucher. Defendant is present and under custody. Defense states the incident alleged in the motion did ocurr. Defense argues in favor of allowing defendant remain released as she has stated repentance for the incident and has received therapy, urinalysis tests and signed a plea agreement. The Goverment requests bail be revoked and presents a picture of the consequence of defendant's action. The Court agrees with the Government that the incident is not a minor one and grants motion for revocation of bail. (Court Reporter FTR.) (Court Interpreter Anie Flores.) (USPO Dana Rodriguez.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 10:14. Hearing ended at 10:22. (msc) (Entered: 02/05/2015)

Def atty requested that the defendant be provided with medication for his multiple medical conditions. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Roberto Ramos-Segarra (108) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 4/9/2015. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Luis A. Rodriguez were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel proffered that defendant may be released on bond and to the custody of his father. The Government was heard by proffer, that this is a presumption case and moved for detention due to risk of flight and danger to the community. After listening to the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:52. Hearing ended at 10:04. Interpreter Edna Brayfield and Sonia Crescioni. (br) (Entered: 04/14/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Julio Rodriguez-Cruz (1) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on

8/2015. AUSA John Mathew, I and defense counsel Francisco Adams were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense is not requesting bail at this time. The Court finds that this is a presumption and defense had nothing to proffer or contest to bail at this time. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 09:47. Hearing ended at 09:50. Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (br) (Entered: 06/08/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jaime Davila-Reyes (1) held on 6/11/2015. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera and defense counsel Lydia Lizarribar. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Parties inform that the Suppression Hearing set for today will not be held, they have reached a plea agreement as to all three cases (CR. 09-0390-01, CR. 13-435 and CR. 13- 534). Both District Judges Carmen Cerezo and Francisco Besosa approve to the consolidation of the cases for plea/sentencing purposes. Therefore, CR. 13-435 (FAB) and CR. 13-534-05 (CCC) are to be consolidated with CR. 09-0390 for plea/sentencing purposes. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, a plea of guilty is entered as to Count One (1) and Six (6). The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defendant to remain under custody. Sentencing Hearing set for 9/21/2015 at 10:00 AM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)Hearing set for 1:00 p.m.Hearing held at 2:50 p.m.Hearing ended at 4:00 p.m.Interpreter Enith Valdes. (sr) (Entered: 06/12/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Yaimir Hernandez-Caraballo (99) held on 6/30/2015. AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Ramon L. Garay were present. Defendant was present in court and on bond. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Indictment. At the time of sentencing, the Government will request the dismissal of the remaining counts. The defendant is to remain under the same release conditions. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance as to Erick G. Ramos-Segarra (88) held on 7/7/2015. Present AUSA Alberto Lopez. Defendant was provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to his rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 Form filled by defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Government's counsel has no objection, that the defendant remain under the same conditions of release imposed in Pennsylvania. Therefore, the Court adopts the conditions imposed and defendant will remain released on a $100,000 unsecured bond. Standard conditions of release apply and the defendant is to remain employed. However, he is allowed only to travel between Pennsylvania and Puerto Rico and cannot enter the Morales Ward located in Caguas, PR. Arraignment set for 7/10/2015 at 3:00 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. Hearing set for 1:59 p.m. Hearing held at 1:59 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:05 p.m. (sr) (Entered: 07/08/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Motion Hearing as to Jose L. Santiago-Del-Valle (115) held on 7/23/2015, re: 3443 Motion to Appoint Counsel and Motion to Withdraw as Attorney. Counsel expressed all efforts made in the case and requested to withdraw due to the communication that has been broke between the client and attorney. The Court addressed defendant and clarified to defendant the criminal history category. The Government informed that there is a presentence report as to defendant's criminal history of V, but not of the criminal history of IV. The Court advised defendant if represented by a new attorney. Counsel was heard as to his request to withdraw in the case. After listening to the parties and defendant, the Court granted counsel's motion to withdraw and will appoint another counsel. Counsel Guzman will transfer the evidence and file to the new counsel once appointed. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 03:29. Hearing ended at 03:49. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Sentencing held on 7/23/2015 for Ramon L. Molina-Quintero (9). Present were AUSA Olga B. Castellon, and for the defendant court appointed counsel Robert W. Odasz. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by the official court interpreter. Counsel for the defendant placed two (2) objections. Criminal History computation, and the two (2) levels added because the offense was committed within a protected location. Both objections were denied, and the defendant was sentenced based on a total offense level of 33, criminal history category of II. Imprisonment of 188 months as to count two (2) in Cr. 11-45-05 (PG), and count one (1) in Cr. 13-534-09 (PG) to be served concurrently with each other, and to be served consecutively with the sixty (60) months term imposed in count six (6) in Cr. 13-534-09 (PG) for a total term of imprisonment of 248 months. SRT of 10 years as to count 1 in Cr. 13-534-09 (PG), and 5 years as to count 2 in Cr. 11-45-05 (PG), and count 6 in Cr. 13-534-05 (PG) to be served concurrently with each other. SMA of $100.00 as to count 2 in Cr. 11-45-05 (PG), and $200 as to counts 1, and 6 in Cr. 13-534-05 (PG).The defendant has agreed to forfeit all rights, title and interest in all assets, which are subject to forfeiture, as outlined in the written plea agreement, paragraph 20. All terms and conditions are specified at the judgment form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. The defendant was remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshals. Count 1 in Cr. 11-45-05 (PG), and counts 2-5 in Cr. 13-534-05 (PG) were ordered dismissed. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:20.Hearing  ended at 11:01.Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. USPO Elisa Abruna (om) (Entered: 07/27/2015)

JUDGMENT as to Ramon L. Molina-Quintero (9). Imprisonment for a term of 188 months as to count one (1) to be served concurrently with the term of 188 months imposed in count one (1) in Cr. 11-045-05 (PG), and to be served consecutively with the sixty (60) months term imposed in count six (6) in this case for a total term of imprisonment of 248 months. SRT of 10 years as to count one (1), and 5 years as to count 6 to be served concurrently with each other, and to be served concurrently with the 5 years term imposed in count 2, in Cr. 11-045-05 (PG); SMA of $200.00, and $100.00 imposed as to count 2 in Cr. 11-45-05 (PG) for a total of $300.00. Counts 2, 3, 4,5, Dismissed. Signed by Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez on 7/23/2015.(om) (Entered: 07/28/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo:Sentencing held on 11/4/2015 for Jose E. Delgado-Rodriguez(4). Present: AUSA Zapata & Atty. Alicea- Luciano. Dft is UC. Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, Dismissed as requested by the government. Count(s) 1 and 6, Impr for 120 months as to count 1 and 60 months as to count 6. Said terms to be served consecutively with each other for a total of 180 months. SRT of 5 yrs as to count | and 5 yrs as to count 6. Said terms to be served concurrently with each other. The Court clarifies that the mandatory SRT for count 1 is 10 yrs. Counsel are aware of this mandatory SRT. The Court explains the error to the defendant in open  court and corrects the sentence as follows: SRT of 10 yrs as to count 1 and 5 yrs as to count 6. Said terms to be served concurrently with each other. The imposed conditions remain the same. SMA of $100.00 per count. (Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz.)Hearing set for 04:15.Hearing held at 04:54.Hearing ended at 05:10.Interpreter Enith Valdes. (ct) Modified on 11/6/2015 to add party name (cm). (Entered: 11/05/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Luis Valentin-Rosario (32) held on 11/4/2015. Present: AUSA Laura Montes and Atty. Hector Deliz. Defendant is under custody and present in court. Consent to proceed before a U.S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to U.S. District Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to counts One and Six of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defendant is to remain detained pending sentencing. (E-mail to USPO) Sentencing Hearing set for 2/16/2016 04:15 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 02:00. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance as to Catheria Carrillo-Lozada (79) held on 4/11/2016. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez and PO Alejandra Batlle. Defendant was provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and her rights. Also, defendant was advised of the applicable minimum and maximum statutory penalties that she is exposed to if convicted of the charges in the indictment. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by CJA counsel. Arraignment/Detention set for 4/14/2016 01:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. As to detention, the government had no objection that defendant be released, but requested stringent conditions. The court adopted temporarily the conditions of release imposed in the Eastern District of Pennsylvania but with the modification that between today April 11, 2016 and the date of the bail hearing, the defendant shall be under home incarceration, without EMD, at the sister in law's residence. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Catheria Carrillo-Lozada (79) held on 4/14/2016. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez, Defense Counsel Jose Velez-Goveo and USPO Emanuel Bravo. Defendant was present, on bond and assisted by the court interpreter. Defendant informed the Court that her true name was CATHERINE. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. She waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for trial setting. As to detention, the government had no objection that defendant remain on bond. After hearing the arguments of the parties, the Court amended the conditions of release imposed in the Eastern District of Pennsylvania and previously imposed at the Initial Appearance: Bail remains set in the amount of $100,000.00 unsecured; Employment; Drug testing and, if deemed appropriate, drug treatment; Home detention with EMD, which defendant shall pay if financially capable to do so; Travel restricted between Pennsylvania and Puerto Rico for any court proceedings; Defendant shall keep the USPO informed of any travel arrangements; Courtesy supervision in the Eastern District of Pennsylvania. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 04:00. Hearing held at 05:10. Hearing ended at 05:19. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (sc) (Entered: 04/18/2016)

Julie Soderlund. Defendant is under custody, present in court, and assisted by the court interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to U.S. District Judge Carmen C. Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to counts 1 & 6 of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre- Sentence Report. (E-mail to USPO). Sentencing Hearing set for 8/17/2016 04:15 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 02:00. Hearing ended at 02:25. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention as to Luis Vargas-Cruz (63) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 5/17/2016. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Jose Aguayo. The defendant was present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts of the Indictment. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge -Carmen C. Cerezo for further proceedings. As to detention, after hearing the parties, the Court adopted the same conditions of release previously imposed in the District of Minnesota. The Court stresses the pre approval of traveling restriction condition between the District of Minnesota and Puerto Rico. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 10:00 am. Hearing held at 11:01 am. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail as to Santos J. Rivera-Muriel (6) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 4/22/2019. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata, Attorney Ian Garcia-Ferreras and USPO Josh Roth. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts of the Indictment. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to U.S. District Judge Carmen C. Cerezo for further proceedings. As to bail, Attorney Garcia-Ferreras stated that they are not requesting conditions of release at this moment but reserved the right to reopen the matter. The Government moved for detention. The Court ordered the defendant detained pending further proceedings. Order to issue. Attorney Garcia-Ferreras requested that MDC Guaynabo be notified of the defendant's health issues, he also requested that the defendant remains in the jurisdiction to discuss discovery. The Court granted the request as to the Notice to MDC. As to the matter of the defendant remaining in the jurisdiction, the Court advised that it can make the recommendation but the final decision rests in the US Marshal Services and the Federal Bureau of Prisons. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 8.) Hearing set for 03:30. Hearing held at 03:58. Hearing ended at 04:02. Interpreter Sylvia Zetterstrand. (ram) (Entered: 04/23/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 7/15/2019 for Arnarldo J. Diaz-Garced (61). Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Jose Perez and USPO Manuel Casanova. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D.  Morgan: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Guillermo Ortiz- Torres (90) held on 2/28/2020. Present: AFPD Joannie Plaza and USPO Claudia Miranda. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Copy of ECF No. 4775 was provided to the defendant. The defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations and also of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filed by the defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. AFPD Plaza requested that the defendant be released on conditions pending the final revocation hearing. The Court briefly recessed to allow USPO Miranda to attend the hearing and provide her input on the matter. Case was recalled at 2:52 PM. USPO Miranda's statements were heard. After having heard the parties, the Court granted the defense's request and ordered that the defendant be released under the same conditions previously imposed as well as the following added conditions: employment and/or education, continue reporting to the USPO as directed and have no contact with the alleged victim in this case, who is the former consensual partner who filed a protective order against the defendant in state court. Since the defendant will be released today, he is not entitled to a Preliminary Hearing. Therefore, the case was referred to U.S. District Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon for Final Revocation Hearing. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing held at 02:33.Hearing ended at 03:08.Interpreter Sylvia Zetterstrand. (lod) (Entered: 02/28/2020)

ORDER - GRANTING 4829 Motion Requesting Order as to Carlos E. Cotto-Madera

Upon review of defendant Carlos Cotto-Madera's Joint Motion for Revocation of Supervised Release filed by both counsel for defendant and for the Government given the current Covid-19 emergency and defendant having waived his right to a hearing( as per representations made by his counsel) and there being no objection by probation, in accordance with the case law from the First Circuit referenced in the motion, this Court hereby grants the request for revocation of supervised release, revokes the same, and sentences defendant Carlos Cotto- Madera to the time already served (The defendant to be immediately released to Guara Bi for inpatient treatment for a period of 90 days) and imposes a supervised release term of seven (7) years under the same terms and conditions imposed at his sentencing hearing and prevalent at the time of his arrest for his violation of supervised release. Judgment to be issued and entered forthwith.Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory on 4/8/2020. (su) (Entered: 04/08/2020)

Cotto-Madera (100) held on 6/19/2020 via VTC. Present: AUSA Enrique Silva, AFPD Victor Gonzalez and USPO Guillermo Arbona. Defendant was present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically for the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations as alleged in the motion filed by the USPO at Docket No. 4854 and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether the supervised release conditions had been violated. After having heard form the government and the USPO, the Court ordered the defendant to remain detained. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Bail Hearing as to Carlos J. Cotto-Madera (100) held via VTC on 7/17/2020. Present were AUSA Enrique Silva, AFPD Eleonora Marranzini and USPO Jeffrey Semidey. The defendant was under custody, present via video and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. The Court granted 4921 Motion Submitting Proposed Release Plan filed by defense counsel. AUSA Silva and USPO Semidey consented to all the conditions proposed therein. The defendant shall be released on Wednesday July 22 pending the Final Revocation hearing before U.S. District Judge Arias under the following conditions: The defendant shall voluntary request admission to a psychiatric  facility for evaluation, treatment, stabilization and hospitalization if needed. ORDER denying 4966 Motion to Reduce Sentence as to Jason Davila-Reyes (21). Defendant has not shown extraordinary and compelling reasons meriting compassionate release as required by 18 U.S.C. Sec. 3582(c)(1) such as an increased risk of severe illness from COVID-19. The Centers for Disease Control "[c]Jurrently has no information about whether people with hepatitis B or hepatitis C are at increased risk for getting Covid-19 or having severe Covid-19". See https://www.cde. gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/liver-disease.html. Standing alone, the mere existence of COVID-19 is not grounds for compassionate release. See United States v. Raia, 954 F.3d, 594, 597 (3d Cir. 2020) ("We do not mean to minimize the risks that COVID-19 poses in the federal prison system... But the mere existence of COVID-19 in society and the possibility that it may spread to a particular prison alone cannot independently justify compassionate release, especially considering BOP's statutory role, and its extensive and professional efforts to curtail the virus's spread."). Signed by Judge Raul M. Arias-Marxuach on 9/17/2020. (mrr) (Entered: 09/17/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release and Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 4971 Motion Notifying SRT Violations as to Carlos J. Cotto- Madera (100) held on 9/25/2020. Present: AUSA Enrique Silva and AFPD Ellie Marranzini. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend these hearings in person and consented to proceeding by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Carpena at Docket No. 4971 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. AFPD Marranzini informed that the defendant would waive his right to a preliminary hearing but had not yet executed the waiver form. The Court accepted the defendant's oral waiver of preliminary hearing, subject to the subsequent filing of the duly executed waiver form. The Court found probable cause as to all violations included in the motion at Docket No. 4971 , pursuant to Rules 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Raul M. Arias-Marxuach for Final Revocation Hearing. The defendant shall remain detained pending further proceedings. As requested by defense counsel, a Notice to MDC regarding the defendant's medical conditions shall be issued. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing to be filed by the defense within 14 days. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 02:45.Hearing held at 02:43.Hearing ended at 02:53.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (lod) (Entered: 09/28/2020)

Minute entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Noel Reyes-Camacho (85) held on October 20, 2020. Present: AUSA Corinne Cordero-Romo, and AFPD Isabel Mattina- Leal. USPO Angelica Rodriguez also present. The defendant was under custody at the MDC-Guaynabo, and was assisted by certified Carlos Lao. All parties connected remotely. The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant has consented to proceed by VTC, and defendant has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record filed at ECF No. 5018. Notwithstanding, the Court made a finding that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived the right to be physically present for today's proceedings, since the defendant has consented to proceed by videoconference after consultation with his counsel of record AFPD Isabel Mattina. Certified Court interpreter Carlos Lao was acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line, as well, at MDC-Guaynabo and the Court had a clear view of him on screen. The defendant waived the hearing and accepted the violations of the conditions of supervised release as stated by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF No. 4896 and 4995. AFPD Mattina proceeded to provide several mitigations factors to be considered by the Court and requested time served, and the defendant be allowed to continue under treatment. The United States requested the middle range of the applicable guidelines. Defendant's Allocution heard. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed by not notifying change of employment, by using, possessing and purchasing controlled substances, frequenting places where controlled substances are illegally sold, by not answering truthfully to the inquiries made by the Probation Officer, not following instructions, and associating with convicted felons as indicated in the motion filed by the Probation Officer in Docket 4896 and 4995. The Court before revoking the defendant, placed several factors considered and imposed a term of Imprisonment of 6 months with a supervised release term of 7 years to be served under the same supervised conditions previously imposed, and one (1) condition added during today's hearing. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa (VTC).)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 09:57.Hearing ended at 10:14.Interpreter Carlos Lao (VTC). USPO Angelica Rodriguez (VTC) (om) (Entered: 10/20/2020)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Noel Reyes-Camacho (85), Impr of 6 months. SRT of 7 years. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 10/20/2020.(om) (Entered: 10/20/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos E. Cotto-Madera (80) held via VTC on 2/24/2021. Present were AUSA Ginette Milanes and AFPD Cherelle Herbert. The defendant was under custody, present by video and assisted by the Court Interpreter. He voluntarily waived the right to be physically present at the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. The defendant was advised as to alleged violations contained in 4863 Motion Notifying Violations to Supervised Release Term filed by USPO Rodriguez and as to his rights. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The defendant shall be represented by the Federal Public Defender. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, the Court ordered the United States to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s] pursuant to Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 3/10/2021 at 11:30 AM via VTC Bridge before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Giselle Lopez-Soler: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Hector R. Ramos-Valdez (103) held on 4/26/2021 via VTC. Present were AUSA Jose RUiz, AFPD Victor Miranda and USPO Jose Benitez. Defendant was present under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations as alleged in the motion filed at Docket No. 5126 and as to his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether the supervised release conditions had been violated. Upon the defendant's request, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by the FPD's Office. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. As to detention, defense counsel requested conditions of release, the Government did not object. After hearing the parties, the Court granted conditions of release, the defendant must comply with all the standard conditions of supervised release and mental treatment as deemed necessary by the USPO. In view that Defendant is under conditions of release, he is not entitled to a preliminary revocation hearing (see F.R.Cr.P. 32.1(b)(1) (A)). This matter is thus referred to the attention of the presiding District Judge for a final revocation hearing. (Court Reporter ZoomGov Recording.) Hearing held at 01:25. Hearing ended at 01:31. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (rom) (Entered: 04/27/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos E. Cotto-Madera (80) held via VTC on 5/10/2021. Present were AUSA Jenifer Hernandez, APFD Victor Chico and USPO Angelica Rodriguez. Defendant under custody, present in court via VTC and assisted by an official court interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically for this proceeding and agreed to proceed with the via VTC due to the COVID-19 emergency and pursuant to CARES Act, § 15002(b)(1). Defendant does not contest the alleged violations. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. After hearing the parties, the Court revokes the previously imposed SRT and sentenced defendant to 6 months of imprisonment and SRT of 1 year (6 months inpatient program at Guara bi and 6 months in the District of New Jersey, if viable. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. Defendant was advised of his right to appeal. (Court Reporter Rachelle Robinson.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:05.Hearing ended at 02:42. Interpreter Ani Navarro. (su) (Entered: 05/10/2021)
THIRD JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Carlos E. Cotto-Madera (80): IMPR of 6 months and SRT of 1 year. Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory on 5/10/2021 .(su) (Entered: 05/10/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial appearance as to Angel L. Villafane-Martinez (35) held on 5/20/2021. AUSA Antonio Perez, AFPD Jessica Earl and USPO Aracely Vazquez were present. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Furthermore, defendant was advised of his rights and the applicable minimum and maximum statutory penalties that he is exposed to if convicted of the charges in the indictment. Defendant was ordered temporarily detained. The Court was informed that counsel Luis Rivera will be filing a notice of appearance in this case. An arraignment and bail hearing was set for 6/4/2021 at 09:45 am via VTC before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116- 182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. (Court Reporter Zoom.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:56. Hearing ended at 03:12. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. (jjr) (Entered: 05/20/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment and bail hearing as to Angel L. Villafane-Martinez (35) held on 6/11/2021. SAUSA Cristina Caraballo, counsel Luis Rivera and USPO Jorge Mateo were present via VTC. Defendant was under custody, present via telephone conference (audio only) and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via telephone conference, waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6. Unless there is an order or directive from the presiding US District Judge indicating otherwise, the government shall have 7 days to produce discovery and the defense 14 days thereafter to file motions. The case is referred to Judge Raul M. Arias-Marxuach for further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. As to the bail hearing, defendant argued for conditions of release. The government moved for detention. DUSM Gabriel Moreno's statements via VTC were heard. The Court ordered the defendant detained pending trial on the basis of risk of flight. (Court Reporter Zoom.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:16. Hearing ended at 10:06. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (jjr) Modified docket text Judge referred on 6/15/2021 (rim). Modified on 6/23/2021 to correct counsel's last name (mem). (Entered: 06/11/2021)
